page.title: 18THE VILLAGE OF BIRKHILL
page.content: Birkhill is situated just back from the A923 Dundee-Coupar Angus road.It has a fairly large population but no proper shops.This is because it is joined, by a thin strip of houses, to Muirhead. Although it has no proper shops it does have a joiners/funeral directors establishment as well as a factory specialising in processing foods such as haggis, black pudding and white pudding.Two other things this village contains are a garage a an inn(the only social facility outwith Muirhead). There are approx. 350 houses in Birkhill about 150 of which have been built within the last 15 years. To the North of Birkhill is Blairfield farm a mainly cereal growing farm with grade B-B+ soil that has been well cultivated.
